values.value: DO NOT EDIT - this will be filled in automatically using the collection pre-request script.
NOTE: use the Current Value to store your API ID
NOTE: use the Current Value to store your API KEY
The user’s email address. This will be the environment owner’s email
The user’s last name
The user’s first name
The user’s job title

The user’s phone number (NOTE: this MUST NOT 
contain a space)
The user’s company
The ID of the environment policy with which the user and environment will be associated.
The ID of the blueprint on which to base the environment

Bolean (default: false) Indicates whether to base the environment on the latest or default snapshot in the blueprint, if applicable.

- true. Uses the latest snapshot in the blueprint (if the latest is not the same as the default).
- false (default). Uses the default snapshot in the blueprint.
The period of time, in minutes, for which the created link will be valid. If not provided, the default value is used. Default: 1440
The project member creating this invitation. If not provided, the id of the request caller will be used.
Bolean value (default: false) to set if the user is asked for apassword when connectiv to thier enviroment
The region in which to create the sponsored link. A list of available regions can be obtained from here. The default region is US East (Miami)
Bolean (default: false) If true, allows login using the returned ‘loginToken’ more than once for the duration specified by {expirationMinutes}

Boolean (default: false). Indicates whether the new user should be sent an email notification after accepting the invitation.

- true. A notification email is not sent to the invited user after the invitation is accepted.
- false (default). A notification email is sent to the invited user after the invitation is accepted.

Boolean (default: false). Indicates whether the owning project member (set by the {inviterId} parameter) should be sent an email notification after the invitation is accepted.

- true. A notification email is not sent to the owning project member after the invitation is accepted.
- false (default). A notification email is sent to the owning project member after the invitation is accepted.
An ID for an enviroment
An ID for an individual VM within an enviroment
Specifies the vanity name or FQDN of a machine, where {machineVanity} is the vanity name or FQDN (e.g. uvo1yg1ocn13278d.vm.cld.dev).
The ID of the class
The student email. This will be the environment owner’s email.
The student first name
The student last name

Boolean (deafult false) Optional. Add a new student to the class now (at the time of the request).
Required if class is configured to only allow login for registered students.
Optional. Extra student information. Only used if required in the class’s project training settings.
Optional. Extra student information. Only used if required in the class’s project training settings.

Optional. Extra student information. Only used if required in the class’s project training settings.

Optional. Extra student information. Only used if required in the class’s project training settings.
Optional. Extra student information. Only used if required in the class’s project training settings.
Optional. Extra student information. Only used if required in the class’s project training settings.
Optional. Extra student information. Only used if required in the class’s project training settings. MUST NOT contain spaces
Optional. Extra student information. Only used if required in the class’s project training settings.
The ID returned by the execution request, POST /api/v3/vms/actions/executepath
A valid command

The Id of the project.
To retrieve project IDs, use GET /api/v3/projects.

Optional. Boolean. If set to true – get the default snapshot for every blueprint. The returned JSON will contain a property ‘CreateFromVersions’, which is an array of one element – the default snapshot.
If unspecified, default is false (don’t return the default snapshot).

Optional. Array. {criteria_value} can be:
 - allowned. Returns only environments owned by the user.
 - allvisible (default). Returns all environments visible to the user.

Optional. Boolean. Whether to return a less detailed or more detailed response. {brief_value} can be:
 - true (default). Returns less detail.
 - false. Returns more detail.
Optional. Filters results by the environment owner's email address, where {ownerEmail} is the environment owner's email address.

Optional. Specifies a type of permission to access the environment. Returns an error (status code 500) if the requesting user does not have the specified permission level. Otherwise, returns the environment properties.
{permission value} can be:
 - view. Returns error if the requesting user is not allowed to view the environment.
 - edit. Returns error if the requesting user is not allowed to edit the environment.
 - owner. Returns error if the requesting user is not the owner of the environment.
Specifies the token returned by the sponsored login API (https://docs.cloudshare.com/rest-api/v3/users/sponsoredlinks/post-sponsoredlinks/), where {sponsoredLoginToken} is the token.

Required. The role which the users share. Only one role can be specified per call.
2=TeamMember, 4=TeamManager, 8=ProjectManager.
The ID of the project member user to whom the end user will be assigned
Required. The name of the business opportunity to be associated with the end user
Required. The number of days to keep the invitation valid for
Required. The recipient’s email. The invitation will be sent to the specified email.
The PoC recipient’s first name
The PoC recipient’s last name
Optional. Boolean. Indicates whether an end user can set email when accepting the invitation. Default is true.

Optional. The subject of the email. The invitation will be sent with the specified custom email subject.
This value will override the custom email subject in the UI.

Optional. The body of the email. The invitation will be sent with the specified custom email body.
This value will override the custom email body in the UI.
A placeholder to contain the PoC invitations URL
Optional. Specifies only to return results that belong to the specified project, where {projectName} is the name of the project.
Optional. Specifies only to return results that belong to the specified project, where {projectId} is the id of the project.
Optional. Specifies to return only options that are relevant to the specified blueprint, where {blueprintName} is the name of the blueprint.
Optional. Specifies to return only options that are relevant to the specified environment policy, where {policyName} is the name of the policy.
Optional. Specifies to return only options that are relevant to the specified environment policy, where {policyName} is the name of the policy.
Optional. Specifies to return only options that are relevant to the specified environment policy, where {policyId} is the id of the policy.
Optional. Defaults to false. When set to true, will only return the owningProjectMembers section.
The id of the account (also know as CloudShare subscription)
A list of project ids.
The id of the webhook.
The URL wherte the webhook event will be Posted
The name of the webhook configuration
A description of the webhook
Optional. Specifies to redirect the user to a specified path within the CloudShare domain (use.cloudshare.com), such as a specific page in the UI, where {redirectPath} is the path.
Required for all roles except if role = 8. The team id which the users are a part of. Only one team id can be specified per call.
Required. The user id that will replace an existing user. The users must be a part of the same project, team, and must have the same role.
Additional user id that will replace an existing user. The users must be a part of the same project, team, and must have the same role.
The email of the invitee. This will be used by the user when logging in.
Invitee’s first name.
Invitee’s last name.
A number indicating the user role: 2 – Team Member, 4 – Team Manager, 8 – Project Manager.
Optional. Set this flag to true if you don’t want the user to receive an invitation mail (default is false).
A response varialable containing the URL of a Invitation sent to a user to become a member of a Project.
The height resolution of the remote access session, in pixels.
The width resolution of the remote access session, in pixels.
Specifies the snapshot to which to revert the environment, where {snapshotId} is the snapshot’s ID. If null, the environment will be reverted to the default snapshot.
A name for the class
The ID of the project member user to assign to the class as the instructor. To retrieve available instructor IDs, use GET /api/v3/class/actions/instructors
The ID of the timezone for the startDate. To retrieve valid timezone IDs, use GET /api/v3/timezones
The date and time at which to start the class, in MM/DD/YYYY hh:MM AM/PM format.
Optional. The date and time to end the class, in MM/DD/YYYY hh:MM AM/PM format. If not specified, the end date will be set to the selected Environment Policy’s storage lease starting from StartDate.
The passphrase that students will need to enter in order to attend the class

Boolean. Whether or not the student invitation email is customized.
True. A customized student invitation email will be used when students are sent invitations to attend class.
False. The default student invitation email will be used when students are sent invitation emails to this class.
String. The subject line of the custom student invitation email. Used if UseCustomInvitationEmail is set to true.
String. The body of the custom student invitation email. Used if UseCustomInvitationEmail is set to true.

Numeric. This option controls access by students and instructor to a lab before scheduled class time. Possible values:
0. Allow lab access before class (default).
Students can access the lab up to 30 minutes prior to class start. The class instructor has access to a lab.
1. Allow lab access before class for instructor only.
Students do not have access to their lab before class start time. The class instructor has access to a lab.
2. No early access allowed.
Students do not have access to their lab before class start time. The class instructor will not be able to create an Instructor Environment prior to class start.

Boolean. Whether to permit users to self register as students for the class.
true. Any unregistered user who has the class link and passphrase will be able to enter the class. They will be required to provide their email, first name and last name and will be added as students to the class.
false. Only users who are added to the class by project member users will be able to enter the class.
Numeric. The maximum number of students allowed in the class (can be null). Maximum value: 60
Optional. The location of the class
Optional. The location of the class
Optional. The location of the class
Optional. The location of the class
Optional. The location of the class
Optional. The location of the class. To retrieve valid values for country, use GET /api/v3/class/actions/countries

Specifies input values for custom fields defined for class creation in the project. Mandatory if project forces validation of custom fields. Fields and valid values depend on custom fields structure for the project. To retrieve custom fields structure for the project, use GET /api/v3/class/actions/customfields

Optional. Boolean. Enables the class to have multiple steps. A class with multiple steps provides students with a different environment for each of several stages in the class. If enabled,enableSteps must be used to specify which blueprint to use for each step and which step to start the class with.
true. The class is a multi-step class.
false (Default). The class is not multi-step.
Boolean. Whether students can change steps independently. Applies when enableSteps is set to true.

Optional. A list of class steps for a multi-step class. Must be provided if enableSteps is set to true.
For each class step, specify:
blueprintId. The ID of the blueprint to use for the step. To retrieve blueprint IDs, use GET /api/v3/projects/ID/blueprints
isDefault. Boolean. Whether the step is the first step in the class. Must be set to true for exactly one step.
The ID of the blueprint to use for the step. To retrieve blueprint IDs, use GET /api/v3/projects/ID/blueprints
The ID of the blueprint to use for the step. To retrieve blueprint IDs, use GET /api/v3/projects/ID/blueprints
The ID of the blueprint to use for the step. To retrieve blueprint IDs, use GET /api/v3/projects/ID/blueprints
Boolean. Whether the step is the first step in the class. Must be set to true for exactly one step.
Boolean. Whether the step is the first step in the class. Must be set to true for exactly one step.
Boolean. Whether the step is the first step in the class. Must be set to true for exactly one step.

Optional. Boolean. Creates a Self-Paced Class that allows a student to enter class at a time convenient to them.
true. The class is a self-paced class.
false (Default). The class is an Instructor-led class.
Optional. Boolean. When set to true, allows for more than one environment activation per student.
Optional. Boolean. When set to true, allows in-app video conferencing to be initiated during an instructor-led class.
Optional. Boolean. When set to true, the Instructors’ cloud folders will be shared on all student VMs.
The student’s email address
The student’s first name
The student’s last name
A CloudShare subscription ID (also know as an Account).
A Public Cloud environment ID. Several ervinId's could be assocated with a single CloudSahre environment.
Specifies the start of the time range, where {starttime_value} is the start of the time range in the format ISO 8601. For example, "2017-01-01"
Specifies the end of the time range, where {endtime_value} is the end of the time range in the format ISO 8601. For example, “2017-02-01“.

Optional. Specifies to skip the first {skip_value} records, where {skip_value} is an integer (default: 0). Can be used iteratively in conjunction with take to view distinct sets of environment records.
Optional. Limits the number of records returned, where {take_value} is the maximum number of records to return. Integer (default: 1000, maximum: 1000).

Boolean.
true. Returns details of the VMs in each student’s environment as well as other details
false. Returns a shorter list of details, which does not include the VM details
The ID of a student in the class
Send invite email now
Disable instructor’s environment creation
The ID of the instructor obtainined from GET /api/v3/instructors/Class?classId={id}
Must always be true
Must always be true
A list of IDs of students to send invite invitations to. To retrieve the IDs of students in the class, use GET /api/v3/class/ID/students
Must always be true

Optional. Default is false. Removes the student from the class if a student with the given email address exists in the class.
This will also delete any active environments the student received in the class.
